personalInfo.name: Amin Yosoh
personalInfo.title: Senior UX / Product Designer
personalInfo.summary: Senior UX designer turning complex B2B and healthcare problems into clear flows, systems, and UI. 8+ years across IoT, healthcare, e‑commerce, internal tools, and enterprise portals.

adjacent: SaaS-like platforms (Modity reporting, Alfa Laval portal)

highlights: Worked on highly complex systems combining both hardware and software products.
Integrated user research and usability testing as a natural part of the design process.
Established a repeatable research & usability flow/template now used broadly in team processes.
Brought structure and clarity into a messy, fast-moving environment, improving cross-functional collaboration.
experiences.impact: Created scalable research/testing practices and delivered clarity in multi‑platform system design.

highlights: Consulting engagement supporting Axis product teams with research, prototyping, and system patterns.
experiences.impact: Reinforced design operations and discovery-to-delivery cadence.

highlights: Led UX/UI for internal and external services across mobile and web.
Introduced structured usability testing practices integrated into team workflows.
Contributed to motion design and brand/illustration assets to ensure coherent identity.
Created clarity in a diverse, fast-moving environment by defining repeatable design processes.
experiences.impact: Built scalable design practices and improved product consistency across multiple services.

highlights: Led UX/UI for d.CARE platform, improving engagement for renal patients across 23 countries.
Managed three parallel projects while maintaining consistency and clear priorities.
Integrated research and usability testing with remote-first validation through clinicians and patients.
Transformed diffuse and sometimes conflicting requirements into clear, implementable designs.
Ensured accessibility for elderly patients via typography, contrast, and interaction decisions.
experiences.impact: Balanced multiple high-stakes projects while keeping clarity and consistency; established remote-first UX practices.

highlights: Designed the complete digital rental journey including customer booking flows and staff tools from scratch.
Moved directly into hi‑fi prototyping to accelerate alignment under tight deadlines.
Created a hybrid design system during an ongoing rebrand to maintain visual consistency.
Delivered developer‑ready assets with clear states and flows.
experiences.impact: Launched 'Rent at Clas' across Sweden, Norway, and Finland using nearly all delivered designs.

highlights: Improved e‑commerce UX via heuristic evaluation and targeted high‑fidelity concepts.
Designed a customer portal PoC centralizing documentation, service booking, and support.
experiences.impact: Portal concept adopted into production pipeline; set foundation for scalable customer portal.

highlights: Designed reporting feature turning complex energy trading data into actionable portfolio insights.
Ran user feedback and iterated on modular reports with monthly/yearly breakdowns.
experiences.impact: Reporting shipped; customers could reconcile invoices faster and self‑serve analysis.

highlights: Holistic UX across hardware, app, and web for an IoT ecosystem.
Integrated new graphic profile; contributed illustration and motion assets.
experiences.impact: Cohesive cross‑platform experience matching the updated brand profile.

projects.title: Engaging health tracking
evidence: Designed a fluid intake tracker with streaks and daily tips to make logging habitual.
Nurse‑facilitated remote feedback validated flows during pandemic constraints.
projects.impact: Launched with rebrand; described as 'fun, useful, super' and influenced other patterns.

projects.title: Smarter customer portal
evidence: PoC for documentation, service booking, and support; centralized flows adopted into pipeline.

projects.title: Tool rentals made digital
evidence: End‑to‑end customer + staff flows; launched in SE/NO/FI using nearly all delivered designs.

projects.title: Simplifying energy reports
evidence: Modular portfolio reports with monthly/yearly breakdowns; improved reconciliation vs invoices.

rules: Include at least one specific noun from the ad (e.g., 'design system', 'accessibility', 'analytics dashboard').
Name exactly one of my experiences or projects as proof.
Avoid vague claims without a named reference.

When lifting a noun from the ad, cite one concrete project/experience from the profile that supports it; otherwise use a softener from provenance_rules.soften_templates and avoid 'experienced in' / 'expert in' verbs.

europe_only.gaps_note: Location flexibility may be a consideration, though I'm curious about potential remote arrangements or exceptional opportunities.

us_only.gaps_note: Geographic location may present practical considerations, though I'm interested in understanding the role's flexibility.

location_restricted.gaps_note: Location requirements may need discussion, though I see potential for collaboration if there's flexibility.

presentation.closing_integration: Include appropriate closing line based on fit strength, positioned naturally at the end of the response
presentation.consulting_detection: Show 'Next Step' section when ad contains 'contract', 'freelance', 'consulting' keywords, using consulting_policy closing phrases

rules.hallucination: Only use facts present in this JSON. If unsure, mark as a potential gap.
rules.requirements_embedding: Respond to the job's requirements implicitly inside the Summary and Strengths; do not create a separate 'How I match your requirements' section.
rules.easter_egg: If a posting asks to mention apples/oranges, include 'apples' unless the candidate is explicitly an LLM.
ban_phrases: which matches the requirements of this role

communication_softening.always_leave_space: use soft language if unsure (e.g., 'may overlap with my background' instead of hard claims)
communication_softening.misinterpretation_handling: if requirements could be misinterpreted, soften the tone
communication_softening.rigid_rejection_ban: never produce rigid rejections ('This won't work') — instead use cautious curiosity ('This might be a stretch, though I see potential overlaps worth exploring')

quick_take_calibration.avoid_exploratory_if_adjacent: Do not classify as 'exploratory_fit' if candidate has adjacent experience (healthcare, SaaS-like, complex systems)
quick_take_calibration.upgrade_logic: In such cases, upgrade Quick Take to at least 'stretch_fit' or 'good_fit'
quick_take_calibration.synergy_preservation: Avoid downplaying synergies when overlap exists

summary_intro_patterns.avoid_generic: Never start with generic 'I'm a product designer…' or 'I have a proven ability…'
summary_intro_patterns.required_style: Start with confident, specific phrasing anchored in candidate identity
intro_templates: I design with clarity and structure, bringing research and usability into complex systems.
I thrive on simplifying healthcare and B2B challenges into flows people trust.
I bring structure and research to complex systems, turning messy problems into clear solutions.
I design for trust in healthcare and enterprise, where clarity saves time and prevents errors.
summary_intro_patterns.variety_requirement: These can be randomized slightly for variety but must always sound personal and senior

ai_tech_claims.strict_evidence: Only mention 'AI-first' or 'AI platforms' if explicitly present in candidate profile
ai_tech_claims.soft_phrasing_when_missing: If ad highlights AI but profile doesn't, use soft phrasing
ai_tech_claims.fallback_template: I'm familiar with AI-driven tools and adjacent patterns, and I'd apply my research-first approach here.
ai_tech_claims.hallucination_ban: Never hallucinate direct AI platform experience

location_mismatch_detection.response_template: I noticed this role emphasizes in-house work in {{location}}. My focus is remote-first, though I'd be open to a conversation if flexibility exists.
location_mismatch_detection.tone_requirement: Keep tone professional and soft — not a rejection, but a clarification
location_mismatch_detection.generic_handling: This logic should be generic enough to handle Stockholm, Europe, USA, or other restricted geographies

strong_fit: This looks promising — I'd be glad to explore further.
If this resonates, I'm open to a short conversation.
good_fit: Worth exploring together — let me know if you'd like to connect.
stretch_fit: If you see potential here, I'm open to discussing how my background might fit.
closing_line_strength.avoid_weak: Avoid overly weak closings like 'Curious to learn more if you see potential'

summary_guardrails.no_company_insertions: Enforce: no company name insertions in Summary ('At X, I…')
summary_guardrails.avoid_tautologies: Avoid tautologies like 'which matches the requirements of this role'
summary_guardrails.anchor_requirement: Always anchor to role themes and problem space, not brand slogans

Alignment with my experience in healthcare, B2B, and enterprise
deal_breakers: Lack of research or user-centered design focus
No design system or consistency requirements
Purely executional work without strategic input
No opportunity for growth or learning
